DataElement.preferredName: Person Negation Clinical Study Protocol Consent Criterion Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A field to clearly define items outlined in the study protocol that a patient denies permission to evaluate.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Negation Clinical Study Protocol Consent Criterion
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents._Permission to do something._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.:Permission to do something.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.
